intro: Dactylus, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is native to coastal areas of the Mediterranean and the Middle East, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Dactylus species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their hardy nature and attractive appearance. They are also known for their ability to tolerate salt spray and harsh coastal conditions.
